about_the_game:
Game Description:

This is a parkour game where players need to control the bride and groom by the keyboard in a race, dodging vehicles and obstacles along the way, while collecting plenty of hearts. Run, run and break your best score!

this Is A Love Letter Ro My Beloved.

I met Jasmine in September 2010, on the first day of high school. We fell in love on December 26, 2010. It rarely snows in my city, but that night, it did.
Fourteen years have passed, and we’re still together. From naive students to professionals in our respective fields, we’ve never been apart. Jasmine is my best friend, teacher, wife, and family—past, present, and future.
On July 20, 2024, we’ll finally walk down the aisle, surrounded by well-wishes, embarking on a new chapter of our lives. As a game developer, I want to dedicate my first independently launched game, ‘Run Run My Bride,’ to my beloved Jasmine. It’s a testament to our fourteen-year love story.
I’ve worked on many games—indie projects and well-known AAA titles—and I’ll continue to contribute to more. But ‘Run Run My Bride’ holds a special place in my heart. Despite its imperfections and time constraints, I’ll polish it with all my might.
These fourteen years have flown by like a fleeting white steed. This game carries my love for her, our aspirations for the future, and my unwavering commitment to game development.
To all, let’s stay true to our initial intentions.
Cheers!

Game Description:

This is a parkour game where players need to control the bride and groom by the keyboard in a race, dodging vehicles and obstacles along the way, while collecting plenty of hearts. Run, run and break your best score!

this Is A Love Letter Ro My Beloved.

I met Jasmine in September 2010, on the first day of high school. We fell in love on December 26, 2010. It rarely snows in my city, but that night, it did.
Fourteen years have passed, and we’re still together. From naive students to professionals in our respective fields, we’ve never been apart. Jasmine is my best friend, teacher, wife, and family—past, present, and future.
On July 20, 2024, we’ll finally walk down the aisle, surrounded by well-wishes, embarking on a new chapter of our lives. As a game developer, I want to dedicate my first independently launched game, ‘Run Run My Bride,’ to my beloved Jasmine. It’s a testament to our fourteen-year love story.
I’ve worked on many games—indie projects and well-known AAA titles—and I’ll continue to contribute to more. But ‘Run Run My Bride’ holds a special place in my heart. Despite its imperfections and time constraints, I’ll polish it with all my might.
These fourteen years have flown by like a fleeting white steed. This game carries my love for her, our aspirations for the future, and my unwavering commitment to game development.

Cheers!
name: Run Run My Bride!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-4790
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4600
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectSound
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-10400
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: nVidia GeForce GTX970 / AMD Radeon R9 280 3GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectSound

short_description: This is a parkour game where players need to control the bride and groom in a race, dodging vehicles and obstacles along the way, while collecting plenty of hearts.
